Get genes driving significant MAGMA_celltyping results

Source: R/get_driver_genes.R
get_driver_genes.Rd

Get genes driving significant MAGMA_celltyping results

get_driver_genes(
  ctd,
  ctd_species = "mouse",
  magma_res,
  GenesOut_dir,
  fdr_thresh = 0.05,
  n_genes = 100,
  spec_deciles = 10,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

ctd

CellTypeData object

ctd_species

Either 'human' or 'mouse'

magma_res

Merged results from MAGMA.Celltyping::merge_results.

GenesOut_dir

Folder to search for .genes.out files implicated in magma_res.

fdr_thresh

FDR threshold for magma_res.

n_genes

Max number of drive genes to return per cell-type enrichment.

spec_deciles

Which specificity_proportion deciles to include when calculating driver genes. (10 = most specific).

verbose

Print messages.

Examples

ctd <- ewceData::ctd()
#> see ?ewceData and browseVignettes('ewceData') for documentation
#> loading from cache
magma_dir <- MAGMA.Celltyping::import_magma_files()
#> Using built-in example files: ieu-a-298.tsv.gz.35UP.10DOWN
#> Returning MAGMA directories.
magma_res <- MAGMA.Celltyping::merge_results(
    MAGMA.Celltyping::enrichment_results)
#> Saving full merged results to ==> /tmp/RtmppEixHa/MAGMA_celltyping..lvl1.csv
genesets <- MAGMA.Celltyping::get_driver_genes(ctd = ctd, 
                                               magma_res = magma_res, 
                                               GenesOut_dir = magma_dir, 
                                               fdr_thresh = 1)
#> Filtering @ FDR< 1
#> 1  genes.out file(s) found.
#> + Finding driver genes for: ieu-a-298 GWAS x CTD
#> Standardising CellTypeDataset
#> Level: 1
#> Converting to sparse matrix.
#> Level: 2
#> Converting to sparse matrix.
#> + Level 1
#> Standardising CellTypeDataset
#> Level: 1
#> Converting to sparse matrix.
#> Level: 2
#> Converting to sparse matrix.
#> Preparing specificity matrix.
#> 0 cell-types selected.
#> + Returning human.symbol
